{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3166087,"name":"","username":"LPryor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-16T15:14:48.089Z","cooked":"

My kids have implemented an autobalance command. It works but they want to be able to interrupt it if/when bad things happen)

The behavior they desire is that if they touch the joysticks that command will be interrupted. Since the drive controls are currently the default command it doesn’t naturally interrupt the autobalance command.

What’s the correct pattern here?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-03-16T15:14:48.089Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":85,"reads":81,"readers_count":80,"score":441.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":430514,"topic_slug":"correct-pattern-to-interrupt-a-command","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55309,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance"},"post_url":"/t/correct-pattern-to-interrupt-a-command/430514/1","custom_user_title":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3166093,"name":"","username":"Spency","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/spency/{size}/184161_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-16T15:22:07.587Z","cooked":"

I would have a joystick button trigger the auto balance command, that way when you release the button, your default command should take over.

Side Note:
From what I’ve seen so far, I don’t know if auto balance in telelop is worth it. The charge station is fairly easy to balance through joystick control and auto balance might be slower than manually leveling.

Hope this helps.

I think a toggle makes sense, and I agree with you that the balance in teleop isn’t too bad. They moved code over from our autonomous and I want to enable them to explore. Either way it surfaced an issue I didn’t know how to answer(the interrupt)

.until(() -> Math.abs(joystickValue) > deadband)

You’ll want to read the joystick value in the lambda.

This was my first thought - but then I was reading about how commands will get aborted by the scheduler if there is resource contention. So before going there I wanted to see what the recommended pattern was in this case.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-03-16T15:29:04.735Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":54,"readers_count":53,"score":15.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":430514,"topic_slug":"correct-pattern-to-interrupt-a-command","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55309,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance"},"post_url":"/t/correct-pattern-to-interrupt-a-command/430514/6","custom_user_title":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3166100,"name":null,"username":"Starlight220","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starlight220/{size}/150872_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-16T15:29:37.730Z","cooked":"

Multiple options:

  • decorate the command with some end condition using until
  • bind the autobalancing command with whileTrue; releasing the button will stop the command. A toggle is also possible.
  • have some condition that schedules a different command that requires the drivetrain

Start","slug":"yagsl-180-degree-rotation-on-round-start","posts_count":6,"reply_count":4,"highest_post_number":6,"image_url":null,"created_at":"2025-03-03T20:22:13.565Z","last_posted_at":"2025-03-04T16:17:51.117Z","bumped":true,"bumped_at":"2025-03-04T16:17:51.117Z","archetype":"regular","unseen":false,"pinned":false,"unpinned":null,"excerpt":"So
